summary.narrativeincludeclinical:
Initial information received on 06 Jan 2010 via consumer's attorney in the form of a civil complaint (Case ID: 1:09-cv-10520-UA): Attorney alleged that the consumer (plaintiff) was injected with Zometa (zoledronate) (unspecified indication, dates, and therapy details) and as a result developed osteonecrosis of the jaw. As a result of the administration of this medication, the patient suffered severe physical and medical injuries and associated disabilities, including severe pain and suffering, severe mental anguish, and the loss of enjoyment of life. Outcome of the events were not provided.
Combined follow-up reports received from a consumer's attorney on 28 Jul 2011 and 29 Jul 2011 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. The patient's date of birth was updated. The record dated 05 Dec 2007 stated that the patient had right breast cancer and received 99 m Tc Sulfur colloid filtered intradermally on 11 Dec 2007 for treatment.
Follow up information received from a consumer's attorney on 10 Aug 2011 inclusive of medical records. Surgical history included tonsillectomy. Surgical procedures included bilateral nipple reconstruction, bilateral mastectomies, lymph node removed, excision of 5-cm mass over left axilla. Family history included brain injury. Concomitant medications were updated. Records dated 11 Dec 2007 stated the patient had diabetes, hypertension, metastatic breast cancer and non-healing wound. Records dated 12 Dec 2007 stated the patient experienced dizziness. Records dated 10 Apr 2009 noted the patient to have mass in right axilla and right axillary abscess. The outcome for the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 18 Aug 2011 via a consumers attorney inclusive of medical records: Medical records dated 07 Apr 2008 noted that there was removal of crown at root #30 of patient. Medical records dated 18 Apr 2008 noted that patient was suffering from osteomyelitis. Medical records dated 23 Jun 2008 noted that patient was suffering from pain at tooth #30. The outcomes of the events were not reported.
Follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 18 Oct 2011 inclusive of medical records: Concomitant medications updated. On 06 Oct 2008, bone scan showed degenerative changes at the mid thoracic spine and proximal thoracic spine. Bone scan done on 15 Jun 2009 revealed multiple blastic osseous metastases at T2, L 3, S1 levels and at 10th rib. On 05 Jan 2011, CT of the chest, abdomen and pelvis revealed interval development of subcentimeter pulmonary nodules and compression fracture at T 12. On 22 Aug 2011, laboratory test showed elevated prothrombin time of 45 sec (normal ranges not provided). Records dated 19 Sep 2011 noted that the patient complained of dysphonia. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 27 Dec 2011, via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: The patient's concomitant medications were updated. The records dated 09 Apr 2010, stated that the patient developed sinus problem. The records dated 04 Mar 2011, stated that the patient developed lower back discomfort. The final outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 05Jan 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records.The medical record dated 14 Feb 2006 stated that the patient had abscess. Record dated 13 Jul 2007 stated that the patient had hematoma. Record dated 04 Nov 2007 stated that the patient suffered with oral soft tissue disease. Record dated 06 Jan 2009 stated that the patient had cystitis. Record dated 27 May 2009 stated that the patient had pharyngitis. Record dated 08 Jun 2009 stated that the patient experienced lower back pain. Record dated 18 Apr 2011 stated that the patient had pathologic fracture and multilevel degenerative changes and disc disease. Record dated 05 May 2011 stated that the patient suffered with chest pain. Record dated 06 May 2011 stated that the patient had congestive heart failure, mitral regurgitation , aortic regurgitation, grade I diastolic dysfunction , hypoxia and shortness of breath. Record dated 23 May 2011 stated that the patient underwent corpectomy and laminectomy at T12. Record dated 27 May 2011stated that the patient had bilateral pleural effusion, lung atelectasis, severe disc space narrowing and atherosclerotic calcification of the lower abdominal aorta. Record dated 01 Jul 2011 stated that the patient had posterior lumbar fusion. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 20 Jan 2012 inclusive of medical records: On 23 Feb 2011 medical records noted disc protrusion at the lumbar level. Blastic metastasis in C7, T3, T6, left transverse process at T7, head of the left clavicle and left scapula was also noted. Records dated 01 Apr 2011 noted that the patient had hypokalemia, leucopenia, unspecified constipation and metastatic lung cancer. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 20 Feb 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. The patient's family history included ovarian cancer (maternal grandmother) and diabetes mellitus (maternal grandmother). The patient received Lasix (furosemide), Lovenox (heparin-fraction, sodium salt), Neurontin (gabapentin) and rosiglitazone maleate as concomitant medication. The record dated 14 Apr 2011 stated that the patient suffered confusion and numbness of the right foot. Records dated 05 May 2011 stated that the patient experienced right lower lobe pulmonary embolism, pulmonary edema and diarrhea. The record dated 21 Jun 2011 stated that the patient suffered vocal cord dysfunction. The record dated 07 Dec 2011 noted difficulty in walking and insomnia. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 22 Mar 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Records dated 17 Dec 2010 noted that the patient was diagnosed with hearing loss and paralysis of vocal cords. The patient underwent breast implants removal. Records dated 05 Jan 2011 stated that the patient diagnosed with metastatic disease in the liver and atrophic uterus. Records dated 04 Mar 2011 stated that the patient experienced worsening back discomfort and increased polyuria. Lab report dated 25 Mar 2011 revealed that the patient underwent external beam radiation therapy for palliative radiotherapy to protect her cord. Records dated 09 Jun 2011 noted that the patient was diagnosed with anaemia. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 03 Jul 2012 via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Record dated 01 Jun 2011 noted that patient was suffering from pneumonia. Record dated 07 Dec 2011 noted that patient was suffering from blurred vision. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up report received from the physician via consumer's attorney on 26 Jul 2012 inclusive of medical records: Medical history included adenoidectomy in childhood. Family history included heart disease. In 2007, the patient underwent surgery of breast augmentation. In Dec 2010, patient had increasing back pain. Record dated 01 Apr 2011, showed that the patient was treated with radiotherapy for T12 metastatic lesion. On 23 May 2011, patient underwent incision and drainage of wound. Record dated 18 Oct 2011, noted that the patient had nausea and vomiting. The outcome of the event increased back pain was reported as condition deteriorated. The outcome of the other events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 12 Sep 2012, via consumer's attorney inclusive of the medical records. Concomitant medications included Remeron (mirtazapine), capecitbine, prednisone, Januvia (sitagliptin phosphate), Dexa(dexamethasone). MRI performed on unspecified dated revealed facet hypertrophy at T10, T11, L3, S1 and central canal stenosis and ligament flavum hypertrophy. Record dated 21 Jan 2011 stated that patient had pain in hip. X-ray performed on 23 Feb 2011 revealed that mild scoliosis. Record dated 08 Apr 2011 stated that patient was admitted because of uncontrolled back pain. Record dated 18 May 2011 stated that patient had blood clots in lungs. Record dated 09 Jun 2011 stated that patient underwent removal of breast implants because of seroma. Record further stated that patient had excessive fatigue, sleep apnea, difficulty in swallowing, memory loss and tingling. Record dated 12 Mar 2012 stated that patient had restlessness and clinically depressed. Outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 06 Nov 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Record dated 03 May 2011 stated that patient had bilateral ankle swelling. Record dated 27 May 2011 stated that patient had infected postop seroma. Patient was hospitalized on 04 Jul 2011 for fever and progressive dyspnea for 2 days. Record further stated that patient had vertebrae fx. Record dated 08 Jul 2011 stated that patient underwent PICC(peripherally inserted central catheterization) line removed. Record dated 27 Nov 2011 stated that patient had adrenal disorder. Record dated 27 Mar 2012 stated that patient had fall on the floor. Record dated 29 Mar 2012 stated that patient had chronic skin ulcer nec. Record dated 11 Apr 2012 stated that patient had tachycardia. Record dated 30 Apr 2012 stated that patient had nonblanchable erythema of intact skin heralding of skin ulceration. Record dated 11 May 2012 stated that patient had occasionally pitting edema to b/l LE (bilateral lower extremity). Report of death stated that patient death on 16 May 2012. Outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow up received on 08 Nov 2012 via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Record dated 02 Nov 2007 noted that patient was suffering from lesion on her mouth and tooth loss. Oral pathology report dated 14 Apr 2008 noted that patient suffered from sequestrum associated with osteomyelitis. Record dated 26 Aug 2010 noted that patient was suffering from upper respiratory tract infection. The outcome of the event was not reported.
Follow up received on 10 Dec 2012 via a consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Patient underwent T12 vertebrectomy on 19 Apr 2011. Record dated 22 Apr 2011 noted that patient was suffering from mild kyphosis. Record dated 24 May 2011 noted that patient was suffering from lumbar wound infection. CT of lumbar spine dated 25 May 2011 showed soft tissue emphysema from T9 to L3. The same dated records mentioned that patient also suffered from necrotic skeletal muscle (paraspinal muscle). Record dated 07 Dec 2011 noted that patient suffered from diabetic nephritis type 2. The outcome of the event was not reported.
summary.sendercomment: Medical assessment: Review of available data reported in this legal case does not allow for proper causality assessments. Metastatic breast cancer is likely to be the indication for treatment rather than a reaction, but the reporting is unclear.
